intro: Alibertia longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stipule alibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
